metadata.title: CVE-2024-4767 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If the `browser.privatebrowsing.autostart` preference is enabled, IndexedDBfiles were not properly deleted when the window was closed. This preferenceis disabled by default in Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox <126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-4767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 126.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 126.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 126.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '126.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
